column4: behaving quirky, still can't get cube to display even tho it's enabled... i guess i need to have something open on each of the four desktops for it to render, right?  but i tried, for example, to launch open office draw on the fourth desktop, and it opens, but back on the FIRST desktop!
Okay
Press alt+F2 and type compiz --replace
Compiz+OpenOffice is a bit buggy so you might need to uninstall openoffice-gnome. It will make openoffice look ugly, but it is necessary to avoid it crashing

getting very strange behaviors, after i did alt/f2 and typed compiz --replace, my whole screen went blank and then i just got like the wallpaper up, no menus or anything showing, except the little lone cursor... i clicked it all over the desktop, and finally this screen came back up.... still no cube, tho, and still compiz manager doesn't appear in menu...\
it should appear under system->prefrences
What compiz --replace does is replaces metacity which is default with compiz
nope, still not there ... this is a fresh install
So you can do metacity --replace to return to metacity
huuuuhh???
If you press alt_f2 that makes another thing called Metacity with no Compiz. Compiz --replace does the reverse
That is alt+f2 and type metacity or compiz --replace
so does that mean i just disabled compiz?
If you typed compiz --replace into alt+f2, no, you enabled it
the last thing you told me to type was metacity --replace, so does that mean i disabled compiz?
Yes
When you want compiz to be re-enabled do the same thing and type comiz --replace
compiz, sorry.
oh, well, this is mom's computer, better leave well enough alone, she has enough trouble just logging on ... lol
lol, I had to do the same with my parents
ok, then, thanks, see yous all lata
